is a small village with 500 inhabitants in
Tourists have been visiting Vrådal for over 100 years, first in the summer but from the 1960s also in winter.

Vrådal is located between the south-eastern and western shores of Norway. 3 hours to drive from Oslo, 6 hours to drive from Vergen and 4 hours from Stavanger (summer).

By car
From Oslo: E 18 to Drammen, E 134 Drammen - Kongsberg - Notodden - Seljord - Brunkenberg, R41 Brunkeberg - Vrådal. 200 km.
From Kristiansand: E 18 to Timenes, R 41 Timenes - Birkeland - Åmli - Trenungen - Vrådal. 168 km

By bus
Nor-Way BusExpress: Haukeliekspressen from Oslo, Bergen and Haugesund til Seljord and local bus (corresponding) from Seljord to Vrådal.
Nor-Way BusExpress: Telemarksekspressen from Tønsberg, Sandefjord Airport, Larvik, Porsgrunn, Skien and Bø to Seljord and local bus from Seljord.

By air
Closest airport is Sandefjord Airport. 150 km.

Vrådal is a small place and you can get around mainly by foot. The hotels are located in the village centre and within walking distance from the souvenir shops and the supermarket. The Ski Centre is located 4 km from the village centre. The hotels have a skibus with departure in the morning and returning from the ski centre at closing time.
Vrådal offers activities all year round.
